DEPARTMENT OF STATE AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT UNITED STATES AID MISSION TO CHINA
MAY 1 0 1902
MC -3619 TO : Mr. C. C. Chang Chief, 2nd Div., Council for U. S. Aid
FROM : Podlecoralina Area Operations Officer
SUBJECT: Requests for Excess Property
In the last several months I have received a number of requests for various types of excess properties to service various aid initiated or currently assisted projects. I am listing some of these requests below for your consideration and action and by copy of this memorandum am suggesting that the requesting agencies contact you directly with formal requests and to work out details.
1. One jeep, weapons carriers or light truck for the VACRS White Clay Mining Project in Kinmen requested by General Liu Ching-sung of VACRS. 140.112.213.82
y
2. One jeep as well as printing presses and printing equipment for the Kinmen daily newspaper requested by the Kinmen Hsien Government.
佳 3927 +1
3. 15 jeeps, weapons carriers or pick up trucks to service ex- panded mountain development operations to be undertaken in connection with increased slope stabilization, tree farming, and mountain farming activities now being planned by JCRR and ourselves requested by JCRR Forestry Division.
4. One motorcycle, jeep or weapons carrier for the VACRS Chihshang Farm. This farm spreads out over many miles of land in many locations in Taitung Hsien and urgently requires more transportation facilities to coordinate with its increasing veteran settlement activities.
爱小
51.5. 10c
5. Two trucks - one each for the refugees from Burma resettled in Kaohsiung and Pingtung Counties and for the group resettled at the Chien Ching Farm. The truck at Chien Ching will be used by the Chien Ching Farm as well as the refugees. One 10 to 15 KVA, 3 phase diesel generator for Chien Ching Farm.
09233
V.O.
2
6. One 15 KVA diesel generator for the very remote VACRS Chiayi Farm.
CUSA
446
E1613,2
國史馆 Academia Historica
年

SUBJECT: Requests for Excess Property
In the last several months I have received a number of requests
for various types of excess properties to service various aid initiated
or currently assisted projects. I am listing some of these requests

am suggesting that the requesting agencies contact you directly with

Clay Mining Project in Kinmen requested by General Liu Ching-sung of
VACRS.
y

for the Kinmen daily newspaper requested by the Kinmen Hsien Government.

panded mountain development operations to be undertaken in connection
with increased slope stabilization, tree farming, and mountain farming
activities now being planned by JCRR and ourselves requested by JCRR
Forestry Division.
4. One motorcycle, jeep or weapons carrier for the VACRS Chihshang
Farm. This farm spreads out over many miles of land in many locations
in Taitung Hsien and urgently requires more transportation facilities to
coordinate with its increasing veteran settlement activities.

5. Two trucks - one each for the refugees from Burma resettled in

paragraphs.content: DEPARTMENT OF STATE AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT UNITED STATES AID MISSION TO CHINA
MC -3619 TO : Mr. C. C. Chang Chief, 2nd Div., Council for U. S. Aid

In the last several months I have received a number of requests for various types of excess properties to service various aid initiated or currently assisted projects. I am listing some of these requests below for your consideration and action and by copy of this memorandum am suggesting that the requesting agencies contact you directly with formal requests and to work out details.
1. One jeep, weapons carriers or light truck for the VACRS White Clay Mining Project in Kinmen requested by General Liu Ching-sung of VACRS. 140.112.213.82
2. One jeep as well as printing presses and printing equipment for the Kinmen daily newspaper requested by the Kinmen Hsien Government.

3. 15 jeeps, weapons carriers or pick up trucks to service ex- panded mountain development operations to be undertaken in connection with increased slope stabilization, tree farming, and mountain farming activities now being planned by JCRR and ourselves requested by JCRR Forestry Division.

4. One motorcycle, jeep or weapons carrier for the VACRS Chihshang Farm. This farm spreads out over many miles of land in many locations in Taitung Hsien and urgently requires more transportation facilities to coordinate with its increasing veteran settlement activities.

5. Two trucks - one each for the refugees from Burma resettled in Kaohsiung and Pingtung Counties and for the group resettled at the Chien Ching Farm. The truck at Chien Ching will be used by the Chien Ching Farm as well as the refugees. One 10 to 15 KVA, 3 phase diesel generator for Chien Ching Farm.
6. One 15 KVA diesel generator for the very remote VACRS Chiayi Farm.
